pullRequest.body:
See https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/kernel.20deep.20recursion.20detected.

Fix
```lean
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Determinant

example : (1 : Matrix (Fin 8) (Fin 8) ‚Ñö).det = 1 := by
  rw [Matrix.det_one]
```

causing a `(kernel) deep recursion detected` error.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [8c17a007f4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15045/commits/8c17a007f448b3a0f846b6326afd3faca28b5bb6)

#### Import changes for modified files

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Could you please explain the fix in the PR description? This means telling which definition changed and why, and telling the impact of this change.
I'm not sure why this fixes the problem, I found it by guessing
I think we should perhaps continue discussion on Zulip before making this change; could you include the Zulip link in the PR description?

Cross-posting from Zulip, the fix in this PR also fixes the following recursion error:
```lean
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Determinant.Basic

local notation "n" => 5

def M : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñö := sorry

theorem E8_det_eq_one : M.det = 1 :=
  -- "manual rref (laughing as I type this)"
  let c0 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñö := ![1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
  let c1 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñö := ![0, 1, 0, 0, 0]
  have h‚ÇÅ := congrArg (fun f ‚Ü¶ c1 1 ‚Ä¢ f) (Matrix.det_updateRow_sum M 0 c0)
  have h‚ÇÇ := Matrix.det_updateRow_sum (M.updateRow 0 (‚àë k, c0 k ‚Ä¢ M k)) 1 c1
  -- recursion errror here vvv
  have := h‚ÇÇ.trans h‚ÇÅ
  sorry
```
Is there any update on this? I have some projects that are relying on this fix :eyes:
Removing `awaiting-zulip`, as I understand, this PR should be using `irreducible_def`.
This looks very promising -- thanks!
As discussed on zulip, I think `irreducible_def` might be a more appropriate fix here.
This looks very promising -- thanks!
As discussed on zulip, I think `irreducible_def` might be a more appropriate fix here.

Can you add a brief comment to this file, explaining what this test is testing? It's fine to refer to zulip for the details, but it would be great if I can get an idea *without* having to read zulip first. Thanks!
Added
Thanks!
Is there a reason you switch the order of the last two inputs?
Is this still true?

pullRequest.title: fix(LinearAlgebra/Alternating/Basic): fix `MultilinearMap.alternatization`

|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Could you please explain the fix in the PR description? This means telling which definition changed and why, and telling the impact of this change.
I'm not sure why this fixes the problem, I found it by guessing
I think we should perhaps continue discussion on Zulip before making this change; could you include the Zulip link in the PR description?

Cross-posting from Zulip, the fix in this PR also fixes the following recursion error:
```lean
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Determinant.Basic

local notation "n" => 5

def M : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñö := sorry

theorem E8_det_eq_one : M.det = 1 :=
  -- "manual rref (laughing as I type this)"
  let c0 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñö := ![1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
  let c1 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñö := ![0, 1, 0, 0, 0]
  have h‚ÇÅ := congrArg (fun f ‚Ü¶ c1 1 ‚Ä¢ f) (Matrix.det_updateRow_sum M 0 c0)
  have h‚ÇÇ := Matrix.det_updateRow_sum (M.updateRow 0 (‚àë k, c0 k ‚Ä¢ M k)) 1 c1
  -- recursion errror here vvv
  have := h‚ÇÇ.trans h‚ÇÅ
  sorry
```
This looks very promising -- thanks!
As discussed on zulip, I think `irreducible_def` might be a more appropriate fix here.
Is there any update on this? I have some projects that are relying on this fix :eyes:
Removing `awaiting-zulip`, as I understand, this PR should be using `irreducible_def`.
